content.description:
Thin and slippery face climbing for three bolts then cut right onto

Undertow

for the last three bolts of that route.
content.location:
Left side of the face between

Green Spot

and

Undertow

.

content.description: Climb a sustained section of face via small slick edges to a ledge and then finish up much easier face to anchors.
content.location:
Center of the main face between Waterfront (5.12c) and

Spider Baby

.

content.description: Continuous climbing up small, slick edges is what you'll encounter on this technical route which requires good footwork and finger power. No real crux, but not many rests either until about halfway up the route; the upper portion of the route is much easier.
content.location:
This route is located on the smooth face 10' left of

Big Red Spider

and just right of

Undertow

.

climbs.name: Liquidity
climbs.fa: (TR) Chris Miller, April 2002, FL: Louie Anderson, 2005

content.description: Another fun route on the streamside face that tackles a slippery bulge; the crux is between the second and third bolts.
content.protection:
4 bolts, anchors

A stick-clip might be nice for the high 1st bolt.
content.location:
The next bolted line right of

Big Red Spider

.

content.description:
Begin at the arête and climb the thin polished face while trying not to slip off.

Named for the nearby roadside market in Mentone.

Climb

Big Red Spider

to the 5th bolt and then cut right to finish up a vague arete with a tricky crux.

Essentially a variation finish to

Big Red Spider

this offers more quality moves for those who have done the standard finish and are looking for something harder.
content.location:
Center of the main face between

Spider Baby

and

Liquidity

.

content.description:
Start as per

Liquidity

and then break right after the first bolt, staying above the hanging arête to independent anchors.

Short but slippery with good movement.
content.location:
Right side of the face and shares the start with

Liquidity

.

content.description:
After clipping the first bolt, make a technical move up to a stance on the arete where you can clip the second bolt.

The 3rd bolt can  be reached direct (harder) or via a slight left / right move.   After the clipping the third bolt continue quickly up the groove.

At the fourth bolt, you are past the difficulties and should trend left up the face to the anchors.
content.location: Shallow corner in the middle of the North Face
